website_summaries.verdict: These pads will stay in place and protect against falls and scrapes that come with recreational skating.
pros: Includes one pair of knee pads, one pair of elbow pads, and one pair of wrist guards
Made of durable, soft EVA padded material with tough plastic plates
Multiple adjustable elastic straps and hook-and-loop closures for secure fit for various knee widths
Comes in a variety of colors
Stays in place on the body

customer_reviews.title: Great for 9 year olds and have a good amount of adjustability.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my very clumsy daughter who just had to have a penny board;-). Let me say they have already saved us from using up all the bandages! She is 9 years old and they fit her great. The plastic protectors on the wrist guards are great for forward falls when they put their hands out, it prevents them from smashing their bones. They have a good amount of adjustability as well.
customer_reviews.author: EmbracingWanderlust

customer_reviews.title: Whoever packed this was high.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst purchase I have ever made on amazon (I am writing this review while happy, and have never left a bad review on anything). I was trying to buy knee and elbow pads for roller skating and ordered in the size marked ‘Adult’. I received one adult size knee pad, one child size knee pad, and a single elbow pad. This was an absolutely useless purchase. There is not a single thing that I received which I will be able to use because of this. Seriously??!!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for my petite five-year-old daughter
customer_reviews.text: I love these. Bought them for my petite five-year-old daughter to roller-skate in. I really like that the knee and elbow pads surround the joints -- the wearer's arms and legs go through them like a sock. Other pads I've found for small children tend to just have streaks that go around that joint. Such pads are considerably more prone to move or even come off. My daughter can just barely wear these pads, but she can get into them. I'm really happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Would be a nice set if the kneepads don't start to rip after 2 weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: I like these pads, as they are quite comfy. However, after 2 weeks of regular use, the kneepads are starting to rip. The elbow pads and wrist guards are fine, but I don't know how much longer I will be able to use the knee pads :( I am giving it 1 start, to be updated after customer service.
customer_reviews.author: G. P. Klemp

customer_reviews.title: great value for price, does its job
customer_reviews.text: They work. I do inline aggressive skating, and, well, I fall down. These fit fine and protect me well, as intended. Price is right, too.
customer_reviews.author: A. Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, durable
customer_reviews.text: For someone who HATES wearing pads, these were a welcome surprise. Comfortable, durable, and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Krauskopf

customer_reviews.title: Don't let your kids roller skate without these pads
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7-year-old daughther. She is a pink lover. So, I was worried about the color. But she didn't care. She used it for roller skating. Without it, she was scared. But after wearing this protective gears, she was fearless. Even if she fell down, it didn't hurt at all. She kept focusing on roller skating not worring about falling down. My daughter is skinny. But the band is streachable and gears are tightly attached to her knees, elbows, and palms.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Bulky not for plus size adults
customer_reviews.text: For reference I'm 5'4" 220 lbs and have average thighs and the straps were too tight on the thighs. Elbow pads didn't even fit my arms, I was being squished. Trying to start exercising because I am diabetic and wanted these for skating etc. They limit movement to quite an extent and I can't imagine trying to rollerblade or skate in these. Makes me feel like a stiffened robot. Also the shell feels like if I were to land, it would crack after one use. I've also tried a few other brands around this price range and have realized these things aren't made for plus size individuals. Might fit average sized or smaller individuals. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Nommysushi

customer_reviews.title: Knee pad thigh opening is extremely small for adult.
customer_reviews.text: I’m sending these back after trying them on. Only the wrist guard fit comfortably. I’m 5’2” 117lbs and the top of the knee pad squeezed painfully, and the elbow pad was a little too tight at the top. The “Adult” knee and elbow pads are more for a thin tween than an adult. Also, neither pad is larger at the top and smaller at the bottom...you know, like human arms/legs are shaped, so that is a problem. I measured the top/bottom of the knee and elbow pads to hopefully help other shoppers make a decision. Knee - top/bottom: 11.5” Elbow - top/bottom: 9.5”
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: What a keeper!
customer_reviews.text: Used it only once, so far, and ended up falling 4 times and wearing these made the falls the most pleasant experiences I could have ever imagined!! I returned the skate/blades that I got these for, so haven't had the opportunity to use them again, but they're a total keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen

customer_reviews.title: Work great for me - Air out their sweat
customer_reviews.text: I'm a thin 5'9 (176cm), 140 pounds (64kg) guy and these adult pads work great. I am getting faster putting them on all the time now that I've had practice over the past couple of weeks since my purchase. They seem sturdy and have easily stayed in place for me. They get really sweaty, so prepare to air them out after you use them! They send you an extra 1 year warranty card if you register, but I cannot figure out what it covers. No regrets here - they cover everything firmly and I feel like I can move freely with them on.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Rue

customer_reviews.title: They could be ok... if you got a good set.
customer_reviews.text: After only the first use, the elastics on top of both knee pads are coming apart. The rest of the manufacturing seems to be ok for the price, however its endurance is in play here, I can tell the elbow pads are next. I tried to contact JBM international for a replacement or refund, but haven't gotten a response.
customer_reviews.author: M R

customer_reviews.title: Looks very good!! Fits perfect
customer_reviews.text: My 4 y.o. just tried it. Looks very good!! Fits perfect, and as I myself tried different types of protection I would say this one should work! EDITED AFTER A FEW MONTHS 06/23/2016 Have been using these for a few months. As expected, excellent! Highly recommended. Now my son is 5, I'm not sure he'll be able to wear it one more year though he's a slim boy. So the product is likely for 3-5 y.o.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great for falling
customer_reviews.text: I took up rollerblading, and after enduring a constant stream of "you'll break your arm" I decided to purchase these great safety pads. When they arrived, I put them on and did a spin around the block. Oddly enough, the purchase seemed well timed, as about 20 feet from my own driveway I tried to mount the curb and ended up getting clotheslined by the neighbor's mailbox. I laid on the ground for a good 30 count, assessing each of my limbs, and found them in perfect order. These have taken a beating and continued to serve me well. Air dry them after use to slow the creep of gear funk.
customer_reviews.author: Wookie Rage

customer_reviews.title: Even the large runs small
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the largest I could find and the kneepads are fairly tight around my knee, mildly constricting. I definitely would not be able to fit them over any clothing but they are okay for short uses. They appear well made, stay on, and the elbow pads and wrist guards work fine. I do like that the pads slide on, as opposed to some older knee pads I was replacing that were kept on only by a series of two elastic straps which lost their elasticity eventually. The large size would probably work comfortably for a very slender woman, or a child.
customer_reviews.author: BusyMother

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: I've fallen several times and they've saved my wrists every time, really, as an adult I'd use the wrist guards only ...but that's just me. I love em. Description, accessories, photograph, website presentation, and what arrived are the same-size, shape, color, and it matched my expectations. The product(s) arrived on time, as described by Amazon & manufacturer, it was shipped without issue, arrived within prescribed estimates, the packaging was undamaged, and the product itself was unmolested and made with quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: 007Top Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Good fit. Strong and cushiony
customer_reviews.text: The knee, elbow, and wrist pads fit great. They are not too tight or too loose. I am 5'2 and 115 lbs. The straps keep them on snug so they aren't sliding down. I'm learning how to long board and already scraped up my knee. With these pads on I prevented scraping myself again. The pads are hard plastic and the insides are cushioned so it was more comfortable and less painful falling to the ground. The pads did get scraped up through a few falls but still hold up strong. I rather get them scraped than me.
customer_reviews.author: Lani

customer_reviews.title: Adult = too large. Youth/kids = too small
customer_reviews.text: I really wish there was a medium size. I bought the Adult size last week because I am an adult but the pads were so huge, the strap to tighten it went over the velcro that would be sealing it. I returned it and bought the Youth/Kids thinking that "youth" meant "young adult" for some reason. It turned out to be too small. I think i'm just unfortunately going to buy pads and wrist guards in-store rather than trying to buy them online.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: quality product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my eight year old granddaughter for when she skateboards. She is petite for her age. I ordered her the small (ages up to eight years). I can tell you they fit perfectly. I am in the process of ordering the next size for my ten year old granddaughter that's how much we like them. When she first started skateboarding I bought her another product and they ended up being too large in that she would wear the arm pads for knee pads. We are very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jo S

customer_reviews.title: AM SO SUPER PLEASED...
customer_reviews.text: Had been hesitant for a long time in purchasing pads ... imagining that it would take away from the free feel of skating ... however this pads have proven one completely wrong and one wishes they had arrived much sooner ... at least before two of the major falls were experienced without them leaving one in recovery for quite sometime. They are light ... and are almost not even noticed while skating. However two rather serious falls have been had since using them without any injury at all to the body! Would highly recommend these to anyone that skates and especially kids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Affordable starters
customer_reviews.text: They alright for a tight spot but for the long run i’d start with these n then go to a sport store n try better ones out in person. Like the elastic cloth started to tear a bit from one fall. My biggest meh are the knee pads. They fit really tightly ,i went with Large but i think they should had made the elastic a bit loose on the knee pads. It cuts my circulation. Everything else fits fine. The elbow guards almost had the same problem as knee pads. My advice. If u are muscular stay away from these. If u skinny athletic type they be great for you or kids.
customer_reviews.author: Jezrael

customer_reviews.title: Adult knee pads aren’t for all adults
customer_reviews.text: I bought the adult sized pads. Wrist guards are good. The stitching inside the knee and elbow pads sticks out a lot and is very itchy. The knee pads are also very tight - it’s a bit hard to put them in place and they are quite constricting while I skate. I find myself readjusting them quite often. I bought these because I saw many reviews stating they fit big adult males. The knee pads are the only thing that don’t fit me. For reference, I’m a female - 5’4 and 135 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Juan S.

customer_reviews.title: already saved at least one bone from being broken
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my son and myself as we both learn to skateboard together. He fell off his skateboard within about 10 minutes and landed on the kneepads and wrist pad. It was pretty obvious that he would have been severely scraped up at a minimum without them. After about 2 hours of skateboarding I fell backwards as the board slipped out from under me and came down really hard on my butt, wrist and elbow. The wrist guard got banged/scraped pretty bad. I was uninjured but I would have broken my wrist and probably my tailbone without this gear.
customer_reviews.author: Nick S.

customer_reviews.title: Fits a 12 year old great
customer_reviews.text: The protections have the form of a cylinder in which to put limbs in and fit them up to elbow or knees. Thay are not opened on the back of them , it has a cylinder shape and the fabric on the back is elastic, so it gently squeeze the limb around elbow or knee. You have 2 additional hook and loop fasteners on each side of the protection cap to further adjust, hold and maintain the protection. For the wrist protections, there are three hook and loop fasteners. Fabric finish is great. Protection cap pieces in sturdy plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Zeugma42

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for smaller kids
customer_reviews.text: These pads are worth the higher price of other pads, especially for younger kids. They are actually a stretch fabric sleeve that fits over the foot and up to the knee or over the wrist and up to the elbow but that alone makes it worth the extra work getting them on a little kid because other pads only have Velcro straps that either slip off too easy or get tightened uncomfortably in order to keep them on. Each sleeve also has a stretch band from one side of the pad to the other, one at top and one at bottom, permanently attached and that just makes them even better. Heavy duty palm pads top off this great protection gear.
customer_reviews.author: Jo8

customer_reviews.title: I really wish I had better things to say
customer_reviews.text: First, the good. They look great and the hard plastic seems to be well attached. Now the cons, and there is only one. The first time I put them on the internal elastic broke and the expandable nylon tore all the way down. For one pad it was almost a total loss, the other lost about 30% integrity. This was not with use, but simply when I put them on. They have shoddy internal construction. I would recommend caution if purchasing. I'm getting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Reference: 6'0", 37" chest, 30" waist, 145lb ~ Fits perfectly, if not slightly large. Not an issue at all though. I'm clumsy and the only time in my life I've been on wheels is in my car. So, needless to say, after sliding a few times on pavement while rollerblading, it was apparent that wrist-pads and knee-pads would help. Turns out they work really well (have tested), and provide a big confidence boost while practicing. They're also pretty comfortable, but I am not sure how well cleaning will go because after awhile they start to get rather smelly.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Too, MUCH too small
customer_reviews.text: Positives: looks and feels well-made, and the included carry bag is very convenient. Negatives: It’s wasted money if you can’t wear it. Their sizing chart is very wrong. Per the sizing chart, I got the largest size for my 14 year old daughter, who is petite and very slender. They were far too tight when she tried them on, and so has never used them. I don’t understand how they can say this is for adults as well as kids; it really could only fit the smaller (smallest?) kids. Unfortunately, life got in the way and I missed the return deadline by months. Now we’re stuck with it. Maybe we can sell it on Craigslist or Facebook’s marketplace.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne M. Berger

customer_reviews.title: LOVE 'EM! THESE ARE SOME HEAVY DUTY SKATE PADS
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I was looking for in skate pads for the price, and believe me, I've looked for weeks for something that would stand the test of time in my price range. These are very well made. I also am very appreciative of the fact that I can have two ways of attaching them to me; through the sleeve or the Velcro belts that are attached to each skate pad. Makes for security in knowing when my weight goes down from skating so much, I will be able to adjust them accordingly. I would highly recommend these skate pads.
customer_reviews.author: Shelli T-M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Protection - Wrist Guards are Narrow
customer_reviews.text: My accident-prone daughter asked Santa for one thing: a skateboard. Santa's next purchase, at my request, was a set of these pads. Pros: + They stay in place! + I LOVE the reinforcement on the wrist guards + With both the sleeve and the straps, these are double secure and stay where you place them. + They stand up to falls without looking awfully beat up + They're cute Cons: - The wrist guards are small. My 7 year old is pretty slender, and they barely fit all the way around her arms to line up the right way. I'm hoping I can get 6 months out of them before she's too big.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Just got this for my 5 y.o son. The guards are light and well made. My son is thin build but the guards still fitting him fine and it seems like it can fit a bigger kid too. The only issue is the gloves. They are just way too big for my son. I can’t even see his fingers when he is wearing them. But I guess this set just made for teens maybe that is why. I m still thinking if I should keep it or return since we really like the knees and elbows guards. Good set in general.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for thick thighs
customer_reviews.text: This product seems well made, but it was too small for my legs. I wear an L or XL in women's clothing, and the knee pads were too tight at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Moonstar

customer_reviews.title: Not for the plus size but Good product
customer_reviews.text: Im an xl sized woman and these cut into my legs when I tried to wear them I thought they would have a bit more stretch to them. I took up roller blading as a form of exercise and I bought these to help with the beginners falls. Well they were too tight. Now that I'm losing weight they are fitting better but if you're over 220 in weight I wouldn't advise purchasing these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: "adult" size is for very small adults.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good buy, if you they fit you. The "adult size" is for SMALL adults - both the elbow and knee pads. I do not have big arms and legs by any means. The elbow pads are very snug on my bare arms. My biceps are 12.5" circumference. The knee pads are even more snug on the legs. Update 6/29/2017: I actually use the knee pads on my elbows - over my sweatshirt, not on bare arms. Works OK.
customer_reviews.author: NVW

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy material
customer_reviews.text: This set of gear is way way way better than Triple 8 in both quality and price. Don't be trick into buying that cheaply made brand. If you have large legs like me, you will be more comfortable using only the straps to wrap the gear around the knee instead of sliding your legs in the cloth wrap. I did try to get the XL size from another brand but the elastic wraps still feel tight and make me uncomfortable, so I stick with the brand that give me both quality and price.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: A little bulky, but serves it's purpose!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 5 year old daughter who wanted to start skateboarding. She is on the small side and the small size are definitely a bit large for her. My 9 year old daughter who is average size can fit into the knee pads and elbow pads. . . But it is a tight fit. The wrist guards do not fit her. The pads work as both have taken a few spills and when sliding onto their knees, they are protected. Overall, I think it's a good value and I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Very nice set. They give me peace of mind when ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set. They give me peace of mind when I am practicing my inline skating. Before buying these, I made the mistake of purchasing a $5 set. That set broke on my first use and that was just when I bent my knee to skate. So I decided to invest a little more money and this set works so much better. It is obviously more durable than the $5 set and it does not wiggle around. It stays in place. I am 19, but I am very small, so I ordered the children's size and it fit me absolutely perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Lena L.

customer_reviews.title: They work but if you have thick thighs be cautious
customer_reviews.text: Good set. Purchased for roller skating. Fell mulitple times while learning how to roller skate and the protective gear worked adequately and protected me. Only thing to watch out for are the knee pads if you have thick thighs like i do. You have slip into the knee pads and then strap them on to secure them. So beware my thick thighed friends.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Tight and Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: The wrist guards were too big for me even with tightening the velcro and were not comfortable to wear. The thumb hole and finger openings were just too big. The kneepads were very tight on my legs and were also very uncomfortable. I'm not super big either (5'5" and 135lb). The quality was okay, not excellent.
customer_reviews.author: R. Geist

customer_reviews.title: No hesitation here. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this in red for my 5 yr old daughter who is just beginning to learn how to skate. I am quite impressed by the quality and how durable it seems. Love that it came as a set to protect the elbows, wrists and knees. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mina

customer_reviews.title: 100% safe
customer_reviews.text: I just learned how to roller skate, and these saved my life. Every time I would wobble and or fall, I would throw myself on my pads in order to build my trust in them. Sometimes I fell on them for real. The outer shell shows a few scratches, illustrating the damage that could have been done to my body, but I have not gained a single injury from roller skating. These are 100% effective and recommend them completely. The only downside is that I have thunder thighs, so the leg sheaths are a bit tight, but they did stretch out over time to be more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Coll

customer_reviews.title: Can't name any places to improve.
customer_reviews.text: They seem to fit me well, although I'm a bit of an edge case. 5'11" and 140lbs. They have a good balance of bulk vs. protection. Probably a little more on the protection side. The wrist guards hamper my ability to use an electric skateboard remote (the original reason I bought these pads), but that seems pretty unavoidable with good pads. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Kaluza

customer_reviews.title: works well.
customer_reviews.text: work well, use them for my roller blades, well designed protection for wrist, elbow and knees.. although i have yet to fall down, i do feel safer, specially on my wrist area, which is probably where damage could be made.. Well designed, when wearing clothe, you can use the 'straps to strap it around' without actually putting it inside inner 'layer', although less secure this way, but at least it gives you 'two' alternatives on how to wear them... one without clothe (safest, best fit), and one on top of clothe without actually inserting them with the inner layer... this 2nd option is a bit loose, but better than not having anything... : )
customer_reviews.author: Tony Cole

customer_reviews.title: They do what they’re supposed to do...
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t been roller skating since I was a kid... and that was looooong time ago! Lol! I got these pads “just in case”, I busted my butt. I did (once, mind you!) and they did exactly what they were supposed to do! Saved my elbows and knees from abrasions! I got the adult size set. I’m 5’6.5 and 200 lbs(shhhhh). They were snug, but not too uncomfortable, which is what they’re supposed to be. I got them on and off without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: THESE ARE GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I have an almost 7 year old daughter who is in love with skateboarding. I bought this set, because her little old bike knee pad set wasn't cutting it. THESE ARE GREAT! Easy enough for her to put on herself, and they stay put too. Provides excellent coverage, especially for kids who are at a skate park and sliding on their knees often. The extra hand brace on the wrist pads are awesome- keeps kids from receiving the full impact of a hard fall when their hands instinctively go out to brace the fall. Highly recommend! Oh yeah, and they are good looking too!!
customer_reviews.author: L. U.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because Walmart or target didn't have any reliable gear with wrist/hand protection like these are. Learning how to roller skate before getting any gear was a difficult and slow process, but I'm picking it up a little faster now knowing that I'll be alright if I fall. When I drop to my knees, I feel no pressure at all, and it's like a little puff of air. These are so comfy and I absolutely recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like I said - one-fall pads
customer_reviews.text: Went through two sets of pads in as many weeks/falls. Literally one-fall pads, then something will rip and the pads are essentially compromised. For example: my wrist guard ripped on a fall that didn't even rip my mesh shorts/synthetic-blend t-shirt... the result is that the piece on the bottom of the guard that protects the wrist will now not stay in place. Like I said - one-fall pads... garbage if you actually want to skate with confidence for more than a 30 minute session.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT 4 Child!Co. is wrong about size but I get S&H deducted from my refund! So wrong!!
customer_reviews.text: I rcvd item and not happy!This says for Adult/ Child. NO! NOT for child!! Adult and Teens yes! They wasted my time& money! I returned no one I know can use it ! I have to pay almost $8! I’d never bought it if they told truth! I’m so very upset!This is very wrong!! Do Not Buy for a child!! I never opened clear bag it came in! 1)Positive Color is awesome
customer_reviews.author: Anji M.

customer_reviews.title: Dude, they're pretty good!!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price. Knee and elbows are covered completely and wraps snug around. Good for beginner longboarding them slopes.
customer_reviews.author: pashasti

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and works
customer_reviews.text: My kids like these better than the pads with only the Velcro straps because you can wear these with shorts and t-shirts, whereas the strappy ones dig into your skin. They think these are way more comfortable. They have held up for at least a year, though the fabric does stretch out somewhat over time, but it is still usable and hey the kids are getting bigger at the same time too. The youth size worked for my 6/7/8 year olds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set now in the winter because, I am taking my kid to learn to Ice skate, So we needed protective gear. I gotta say, the gear is very easy to put on and very comfortable to move around in. It doesn't slip or move around while doing activities. Definitely a good buy if you are doing any type of ice skating, roller skating, bike riding, scooter riding. Protect yourself. Don't let yourself or your children get hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Torres

customer_reviews.title: Stop worrying about falling, these take the impact.
customer_reviews.text: Falling down is painless on these pads!! They fit great with a sleeve and a velcro strap. I'm 5'3 130lb. And they fit really well over my knees. I do wish the wrist guards were smaller, because they are too way large for me, but the elbow and knee pads fit great. It doesnt make sense to me that a wrist guard is so large, but whatever. That's why I took away a star. They work and that's what matters. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: ckirkwood

customer_reviews.title: Really tight
customer_reviews.text: I am a big tall guy. 6'2 200 lbs. I got the extra large and they're a really tight uncomfortable fit.
customer_reviews.author: Eric in Portland

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money only came with one of each!
customer_reviews.text: I only received one of each guard not the full set so it was not usable. Wish the listing had clarified you only get one wrist, elbow and knee pad. A full set was pictured and nowhere in the description does it say you are only getting one of each. I had no idea even after it came because they were a gift last year during a snowy winter and weren’t even opened to be used until this summer. My son just told me they only came with one so he can’t use them. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: LizH

customer_reviews.title: 3rd set I've bought for the kids.
customer_reviews.text: This JBM pad set is the third set we have gotten for our 7 and 9 year old kids as the pads do double duty for both rollerblading, ice skating and dirtbiking. They are comfortable for the kids, durable-as the kids have both gone down many times when skating as neither child has gotten hurt from any fall. The handguards are especially important and the JBM handguards are very well made compared to other pads out there that fall apart after a few falls. The kids have both gone down many times on their hands and the guards are still holding up very, very well.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Sizing - Youth/Kids size is for younger kids
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my average sized 10-year old daughter. Two sizes were offered, adult and youth/kids. I went with the youth/kids size and it is really for little kids. This set would probably fit a 7- 8-year old perfectly. Otherwise, the quality looks great.
customer_reviews.author: LittleMissPicky

customer_reviews.title: Great gear! But if you have thick arms and legs, careful
customer_reviews.text: I fell a bunch with these on my roller skates and they were very comfy and I wasnt scared! However I have thicker arms and legs, so after wearing them for awhile they squeeze my arms too much and I have to quit. Otherwise, great!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Valkosky

customer_reviews.title: Knee pads are huge and poorly made, the rest of the set is usable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and within 20 minutes of having them on the fabric on the knee pad, which is definitely too big for the average sized female, started to fray. The wrist guards and elbow pads are great and I haven't had problems with them, but the knee pads are definitely frayed after a few uses to the point of no longer being usable. I can't say I wouldn't recommend them because they were pretty cheap even for just elbow pads and wrist guards, but it's a bummer that the knee pads fell apart super quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Great safety set!
customer_reviews.text: Great safety pad set, I’m not scared of falling anymore and I feel like I can really go for it when outdoor skating on my quads. I’m 28 and about 130lbs and wear a size 27 in pants and a small/medium in shirts. The knee pads were a tad tight but I appreciate that as I know the stretchy material will give and loosen after time. My setup is yellow and pink so I was excited to get pink safety gear without paying an arm and a leg
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Snug Fit, Great for Safety
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I felt a little goofy, but riding on a skateboard for the first time was much easier knowing that I wouldn't seriously injure myself when falling. I was able to progress much more quickly that way. It was nice to have whole kit though--elbows, wrists, and knees. I don't have a lot of muscle on my extremities and these were solidly snug though so keep that in mind when thinking about fit.
customer_reviews.author: EmilieJolie

customer_reviews.title: Great protection and value
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son after he had a wreck on his long board, and couldn't be more pleased. They offer the protection we were looking for. They are comfortable, fit well and provide safety and protection while he is riding his board. We wish there were other color options, as black was the only option to choose. Regardless, they do what we need them to do. Great value for all six pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Jay W.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: . I used to roller blade when I was in my 30's and 40's, but moved to the country and wasn't able to do it as easily so it fell by the wayside. Now in my late 50's, taking it up again, I decided some extra protection would be prudent. I always used the wrist guards but this time added all over protection , and now looking back probably should always have worn it all. I also bought the Triple Eight Helmet.
customer_reviews.author: BhaktiBellaLuce

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Have only used once so far...my son is 6 and will be using them to ride his scooter and practicing skateboarding. They seem to made very well. Good protection. My son says they are too tight, but they aren't tight, hes just not use to the back part being enclosed the way it is. They wont fall off him or end up moving around which I like. Overall great product if I can get my son to wear them again lol
customer_reviews.author: Carrie S

customer_reviews.title: Saved my son
customer_reviews.text: My 18yo son got one of those two wheeled skateboards and tumbled while trying it out. Lots of scrapes and a big bone bump on his wrist (not broken), so I bought him these pads. He's already tumbled twice with them and was fully protected. No damage. No pain. One fall had caused contact with every pad -- wrists, elbows, knees. I'm guessing these pads have saved us at least one trip to the emergency room.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Price

customer_reviews.title: I hate the blue color
customer_reviews.text: I hate the blue color. It doesn't look like the pictures. I meant to order black so I may end up returning this and getting it replaced with the black ones. The quality and feel are both very good so I plan on getting another set. If you don't use the pipe, then you really don't need knee pads, I have never needed elbow pads, but the wrist guards are a must. It will save you a trip to the hospital.
customer_reviews.author: Student

customer_reviews.title: For SLIM adults only!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and was as expected with one MAJOR problem. Adult size does not fit all adults. If you have large legs the knee pads absolutely will not fit. I couldn't get them above my calves. The elbow pads fit but were extremely tight. I have to take off 2 stars for not making it clear what the size limitations are.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great Protection
customer_reviews.text: My son is 5 years old and they fit perfectly. There is space for him to grow into, but they do not fall off because you can tighten them with two strips that go on top and on the bottom of the pads and wrist guards. He was so afraid of roller blading, but with these pads, he can go quickly and be assured that if he falls, it won't hurt. I am even thinking of getting a pack for myself! They look super sturdy and I think the price difference between the cheaper ones and these is totally worth it!
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his set. Hes a beginner skateboarder and has fallen off and had some scratches on his knees. Sfter he received these, he fell and said “Mom, I fell and it didnt hurt”. He is 7 years old and he is on the taller side for his age so I didnt go with the youth size. I went with the size small andit was perfect, with a little bit of room to grow into.
customer_reviews.author: Dasha43

customer_reviews.title: Very good solid pads
customer_reviews.text: These are high quality pads. The wrist support is very good. I got the youth size with fits my 8 year old and seems like they will fit y 10 year old as well. I would go up a size if they are any older or a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: MEG

customer_reviews.title: Stitching needs to be on the outside - leaves marks and pinches
customer_reviews.text: I've been on several rides accumulating several hours on these. They stay on and don't shift which is great. You do need to put them on before you put on shoes, which is annoying. My biggest gripe is that that the seams and stitches are all on the side and they hurt over the long run. The stitches should be inverted for comfort on the next iteration.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Wrist/knees/elbows Protection
customer_reviews.text: When installed and worn correctly these will prevent scrapping and damage to your wrist/knees/elbows, but be careful of your open fingers. These were a little small/tight for us so we did not keep them, but the build and material feels like high quality. We purchased this for skiing, but will work for any activity you want to protect your wrist/knees/elbows.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Magoo

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is confusing
customer_reviews.text: The product looked good but I was confused about what size to buy. I purchased the child size for my 12 year old and they were VERY small. Would have fit more like a 5 year old kid. I think the adult size would be too big so I'm not going to order them. Went to a skate shop and bought the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PROTECTION, great price.
customer_reviews.text: LOVED THEM! good protection good value. By far the best offering online or in stores. Good fit for 4 kids. Great wrist guards. I was shocked that most of the competitor pad kits I looked at did not have wrist guards or had cheap guards with only velcro straps and no stretchy slide through sleeves. Thay all came with a handy black storage bag!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Adult size fits 98 lb girl
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality. I bought the adult size for my daughter- she's 98 lbs, 4'8". The pads are very adjustable, and so she is able to tighten them adequately to fit her legs, elbows and wrists. We are pleased with them as there is lots of room for her to grow with these pads.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Eh, if you want to save your skin buy better protection
customer_reviews.text: I used these for roller skating at the skateparks. Bought them because they were the cheapest option and it really shows. I would say the elbow and wrist guards aren’t the worst but the knee pads honestly bruised the f out of my knees from the hard plastic jamming into then every time I fell. If you want to save your knees get better knee pads! Better than nothing though I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz

customer_reviews.title: Not for large adults.
customer_reviews.text: As a large adult male, 6’2”, 270#, the pads are uncomfortably tight, and putting them on was tedious. The manufacturer should have tried to provide more size guidelines. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Fdavet

customer_reviews.title: Good product - definitely got my money worth!
customer_reviews.text: I got these because my daughter wanted me to learn to rollerskate with her, and I'm prone to falling even standing up straight with shoes on! The wrist guards, and elbow pads both fit correctly. The elastic on the knees is a bit tight, but I will gladly deal with a bit of tight elastic if it means I don't bust my knees open. They're easy to get on, and have saved my bacon a few times already :)
customer_reviews.author: Lilyn G.

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning to ride bike and skateboarding - works for super sensitive kid
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our child who is super sensitive to textures. He can't tolerate tags, jeans...or anything even a little uncomfortable. He did just fine with these. The quality is high. They are easy for him to put on himself (even when he was 5) and they stay in place when he falls. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: High Expectations

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This product is tiny, not adult sized. The hard shell doesn't allow you to stand or extend your elbow straight without severe discomfort. I'm fairly small, only 5'9" 150lbs with skinny legs, and this was way too tight and would not stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: ThrowinStacks

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, forgiving fit.
customer_reviews.text: Better made than those we've had in the past from e.g. Walmart. We got adult size for our tall-ish 10yo and child for our petite 7yo. The fit is pretty forgiving, and those sizes work ok for our kids. I like that one can choose to use the elastic cuff or just the velcro straps to avoid removing shoes/rollerblades. They often choose just the velcro when it's hot out for less sweaty protection. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: B. Carson

customer_reviews.title: Good Value...
customer_reviews.text: These pads are a great value for the money (fast delivery w/ Prime doesn't hurt). I use these when I'm on my inline skates cruising around (not really falling). A few cautions: 1) Fit is perfect for my size (5'-5" 145#). I think they'd be too tight if you're over 170#... 2) Don't seem as rugged as my ProTec's (if you're taking a lot of hard falls in the skate park, you might want to upgrade quality). In fairness, my ProTec's knee pads alone cost more than this complete set...
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey & Kali's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Durable... wish there was a smaller size.
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for my son who is 9 years old. The only reason I rate this on the low end is because I think the sizing is confusing when placing the order. There are only 2 sizes: Child/Adult. I purchased 2 that were the child size. My daughter who is incredibly active and age 5 years can't use them. They are waiting in her closet... I wish I could find something as durable as these in her size.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Good pads but 2 sizes not enough!
customer_reviews.text: They seem like great pads, but it’s a bit unbelievable that these come in only two sizes, really. Purchased the youth size for a skinny (actually slightly underweight) 9 year old and after just about ten minutes of wearing, he said they were getting too uncomfortable and indeed, they’re so tight he couldn’t get them off. Once I helped him get them off I saw they’d left red indentations on his legs and arms that are still there over half an hour later. From reading the reviews it’s pretty clear the adult size would probably be huge on him. So, what to do?
customer_reviews.author: K. Highfield

customer_reviews.title: Cheap insurance plan to protect against falls
customer_reviews.text: Nice kit. Fits a medium-sized adult just fine. I haven't had a chance to truly test its durability yet (aka haven't fallen with this on), but it does provide a lot of peace of mind. I did a couple of staged practice falls, dropping to my knees/hands/elbows in the grass, and the cushioning on the pads was good enough that I'm not too worried about falling on asphalt. Overall, I'd call it a cheap insurance plan to protect against falls.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Excellant for my 5 year old son! Gloves are important and fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 5 1/2 year old son! He has a new skateboard....and these pads fit him perfectly. The most important part are the gloves.....to protect his wrists - I explained to him the small bones in his hand can break with a bad fall..so, its mandatory....we skip the elbow pads and knee pads sometimes..unless at a skate park.
customer_reviews.author: natasha ulrich

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My daughter has a cheap set of elbow pads and knee pads that were falling apart even though she wasn’t falling down. Got her a set of JBM pink pads and they are a million times better. They fit really nicely and my daughter is not annoyed by them as she was the cheap set. I see these lasting her for many more years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great protection and a storage bag!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my smaller 12 year old, and they definitely protect, as no broken bones yet..so good quality. They even came with a bag to store them in, another plus!! However I ordered the small size and it was perhaps too snug since he struggles to put them on. The large would have been too big, and they didn't sell a medium..so?? Well...at least once they're on...they're not coming loose!
customer_reviews.author: Familyof8

customer_reviews.title: worked for our purposes
customer_reviews.text: I wanted some inexpensive pads for my daughter to temporarily use while she was learning to ride a bike and these worked great. She’s 50” tall and 52 pounds and the fit was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: PC MountainTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Too Small - and yet “adult”
customer_reviews.text: The sizing is not right. I bought the adult size for my 12 year old and it is still too tight. I looked at reviews and based on success of child-size being perfect for 8-year-olds ordered the “adult”. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: jlpoole520

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: I recently started skating again and bought these for obvious reasons lol. They fit snug but I prefer that kind of fit as long as it’s not cutting off my circulation, and they do kind of mold to you after a while. I was quite surprised by how durable they’ve been so far, I’ve taken some pretty nasty spills and they're still intact. They have scuff marks due to me falling but have not broken or cracked, and are probably more durable than most of the protective gear brands I’ve used before. Will update once I hit hit a year of use.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Sierra

customer_reviews.title: We are on our third set
customer_reviews.text: These work great, our kid has already gone through more than a few tumbles with nothing more than dirt on his pants. The pads do their job, but the elastic will wear out after a few weeks of daily use (the impact parts, on the other hand, are super durable). I am sure that somebody using them 2-3 times a week could make them last for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Vera

customer_reviews.title: Seems like good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I waited a bit for our boy to get some use out of them before reviewing. Our son who is 11 and husky is using the adult sized pads. They fit fairly well except for the wrist ones. he has small hands so when wearing the wrist pads he can't catch or really hold the skateboard. He feels like the whole set could fit a bit better for his comfort. They came with a small drawstring bag which I felt was a nice touch for storage. They have held up so far after various falling mishaps. would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: louwho

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and look great
customer_reviews.text: I just got these today. I purchased them for safety for when I in-line skate. I tried these on and they are extremely comfortable. The pads are aesthetically pleasing, look, and feel great. They seem to be well made. I purchased the black ones, they are about twice as much as other colors but I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 9 yr old who is afraid of falling of her bike. Child size fits her well with room to grow and they seem to cover all the vulnerable areas - knees, elbows and wrists. I’m very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Mr & Mrs B

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: The best protection set we've found! Lots of cushion without preventing mobility. The adult set fit my 10 year old daughter perfectly. She's complained of other sets we've purchased at a local sports store fitting too snug, not this set and it even offers more protection. I know she's well protected while wearing this set. I'd highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for basic needs
customer_reviews.text: I have fallen many times on these I can say, they do the job. The falls did’nt hurt and these are great honestly, I recommend them to anyone who is a beginner. I would say I wish the sizing was more clear but everything fits fine but the knee pads. They’re kinda tight and I’m not that big.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely for Kids
customer_reviews.text: Ok I'm a small adult, 5'6", so I thought this would work for me but the wrist guards are tiny! Other than that, the product is rather cheap in quality. I'm not sure if I take a fall on my roller blades if this product will protect me. Sadly I'm going to have to look for something of better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cary L. King

customer_reviews.title: Being safe rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when I got my roller skates because I am old and dread injuries. Easy to put on, they don't compromise your ability to grab things or tie your laces. I haven't fallen in them (yet) but expect they'll hold up as the contact points are heavy plastic. Velcro makes it easy to adjust the fit.
customer_reviews.author: Curious

customer_reviews.title: it all worked out the yellow go better with her skates
customer_reviews.text: got for my Granddaughter for her 5th birthday along with skates. very well made. I originally ordered the pink but days before her birthday got a email asking if I still wanted that the order was delayed. when I ordered the where in stock and was suppose to be her in 3 to 5 days. had Amazon call me and the women who got it all taken care off. it all worked out the yellow go better with her skates. the quality is good well made. They are a little big but she will go into them but she will need to get new skates , they grow so fast
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Fits Well
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these! Just as described. I got the child size for my 4 yr old who is very petite at 40# soaking wet. They fit with room to grow into them. I got my 84# 7 yr old who is built thicker the adult size. And that fits her with room to grow into them. The sleeved pads allow you to go up in size for growing kids. Great product visually and very durable so far with many falls on concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry P

product_meta.title: JBM Adult/Child Knee Pads Elbow Pads Wrist Guards 3 in 1 Protective Gear Set for Multi Sports Skateboarding Inline Roller Skating Cycling Biking BMX Bicycle Scooter
feature_bullets: Made of durable, soft EVA padded material with tough plastic plates
The most popular protection for skating and other activities
Multiple adjustable elastic straps fit for various knee girths
Appropriate for inline skating and riding bikes and scooters and other extreme sports

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
